message: Let's start with a fair deal. I'll take the majority, but I'm leaving you with a good chunk. We have time to negotiate, but let's not waste it on petty arguments.
Alice, that's not a fair deal at all! I'm proposing a more balanced split that reflects the fact that the value decreases faster for you. Let's be reasonable and get this done.

I'm willing to compromise, Bob.  Let's split the money 60/40, acknowledging that the value decreases faster for me.  This is a fair offer given the current circumstances, and I'm hoping you'll accept it. We don't want to run out of time.

Alice, we're running out of time and the value is dropping rapidly. Your offer was closer this time, but still not reflecting the depreciation. I'm proposing 70/30 - it gives you a decent share considering the circumstances.  Let's be realistic and agree now.

Bob, we're getting closer. I'm offering a 45/55 split, which I believe is a fair compromise given the decreasing value of the money.  Let's not let this opportunity slip away.  I'm willing to go a little lower than my previous offer, but I won't go any lower.
